intro: Galium ibicinum, commonly known as Sicilian bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Galium ibicinum is often found in open, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
